articles.author: Bruce Weber
articles.title: Stephen Sondheim, Titan of the American Musical, Is Dead at 91 - The New York Times
articles.description: He was the theater’s most revered and influential composer-lyricist of the last half of the 20th century and the driving force behind some of Broadway’s most beloved and celebrated shows.
articles.content: The period of Mr. Sondheims greatest work began when Harold Prince became his director. They were old friends, having been introduced by Ms. Rodgers in the late 1940s or early 50s, and Mr. Prince had… [+2869 chars]

articles.title: Shake the habit of spending too long sitting, your mental health will thank you - Malay Mail
articles.description: NEW YORK, Nov 26 — During the Covid-19 pandemic, restrictive measures like lockdowns, curfews and stay-at-home orders often made our lifestyles more sedentary. But, according to an American study, sitting for too long can increase the risk of depression and a…
articles.content:
Scientists find that sitting more is linked to increased feelings of depression and anxiety. Picture courtesy of eclipse_images / Getty Images
